SEARCH
Package edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler

Class WolfScheduler

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc216.wolf_scheduler.scheduler.WolfScheduler
public class WolfScheduler extends Object
WolfScheduler creates a schedule for the current user (a student) and provides functionality for naming the schedule, adding a Course to the schedule, removing a Course from the schedule and resetting the schedule
Author:
Priyanshu Dongre

  • Method Details

    • getCourseCatalog

      public String[][] getCourseCatalog()
      This method returns an array which is used in the GUI to create the table of course catalog information. There is a row for each Course and three columns for name, section, and title. If there are no Courses in the catalog, an empty 2D String array is returned.
      Returns:
      catalog a 2D String array of the catalog.

    • getScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getScheduledActivities()
      This method returns an array which is used in the GUI to create the table of course catalog information. There is a row for each Course and three columns for name, section, and title. If there are no Courses in the schedule, an empty 2D String array is returned.
      Returns:
      a 2D String array of the schedule.

    • addCourseToSchedule

      public boolean addCourseToSchedule(String name, String section)
      addCourseToSchedule() returns true if the given Course (represented by the name and section) meets the following criteria: 1) the course exists in the catalog and 2) the course is successfully added to the student’s schedule. If the Course is not in the catalog, it cannot be added to the schedule and the method returns false. A Course with the same name as another Course already in the schedule cannot be added to the schedule. This means a student can’t be enrolled in both Section 001 and 002 of CSC216 at the same time. If a Course with the same name is already in the schedule, an IllegalArgumentException with the error message of “You are already enrolled in {course name} is thrown.
      Parameters:
      name - -> Name of the course
      section - -> Section of the course
      Returns:
      true if course is added, else false;

    • addEventToSchedule

      public void addEventToSchedule(String eventTitle, String eventMeetingDays, int eventStartTime, int eventEndTime, String eventDetails)
      Method that adds the event to the Schedule.
      Parameters:
      eventTitle - Title of the event
      eventMeetingDays - The day the event is happening
      eventStartTime - Time the event starts
      eventEndTime - Time the event ends
      eventDetails - Details of the event

    • getFullScheduledActivities

      public String[][] getFullScheduledActivities()
      This array is used in the GUI to create the table of course catalog information. There is a row for each Course and six columns for name, section, title, credits, instructorId, and the meeting days string (e.g., getMeetingString(). If there are no Courses in the schedule, an empty 2D String array is returned.
      Returns:
      a 2D String array of the schedule with all information.

    • removeActivityFromSchedule

      public boolean removeActivityFromSchedule(int idx)
      This method removes courses from the schedule.
      Parameters:
      idx - index of the activity in the schedule.
      Returns:
      true if the given Course (represented by the name and section) can be removed from the student’s schedule. The Course should be removed.

    • resetSchedule

      public void resetSchedule()
      This method resets the schedule.

    • exportSchedule

      public void exportSchedule(String fileName)
      exportSchedule() receives a String parameter that is the filename where the student’s schedule will be saved to. You will use the CourseRecordIO.writeCourseRecords() to export the file. If CourseRecordIO.writeCourseRecords() throws an IOException, catch it and throw a new IllegalArgumentException with the message of “The file cannot be saved.”.
      Parameters:
      fileName - -> name of the file to export the schedule.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if file cannot be saved

    • setScheduleTitle

      public void setScheduleTitle(String title)
      Sets Custom Title to schedule.
      Parameters:
      title - -> Custom Title

    • getScheduleTitle

      public String getScheduleTitle()
      Returns Schedule title
      Returns:
      the title of the schedule.

    • getCourseFromCatalog

      public Course getCourseFromCatalog(String name, String section)
      getCourseFromCatalog() has two parameters: a course name and section. Since a Course in the catalog is distinct by name and section we can use those two items to find a Course.
      Parameters:
      name - -> name of the course
      section - -> section of the course.
      Returns:
      required course. If the Course with the given name and section does not exist in the catalog, return null.
